GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

topics.description: All about the food we wish we could eat more of!

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users

GET /api/articles.description: Serves an array of all articles, ignoring the body-property, and adding comment_count based on each articles article_id, by default the list will be ordered by the created_at time stamp in descending order. It can be queried using sort_by, order and topic. If no topic is provided it will serve all articles. Limit and p (page) queries can be added, by default it limits articles to 10 per page. It also defaults to start on page 1.

POST /api/articles.description: Adds a new article to the database and returns the newly added article, including a comment_count property. The request body must include author, title, body, and topic fields. Providing an article_img_url is optional; otherwise, a default img URL will be used.

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Serves an array of comments for the given article_id, sorted by most recent comment first. Queries available are limit for how many results per page and p for page-number, the default values are 10 results per page, and page 1

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Creates and adds a new comment for the given article_id, a valid username and body is require in the input request

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: Updates the vote count for a specific article, and then serves the updated article

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Updates the votes on a comment based on its comment_id, and returns the updated comment
